workflow.name: Automatically email great leads when they submit a form and record in HubSpot
workflow.description:
## Use case
This workflow automatically qualifies great leads from a form and sends them an email üòÆ..
It also adds the user to Hubspot if not already added and records the outreach.

## How to setup
1. Add you **MadKudu**, **Hunter**, and **Gmail** credentials 
2. Setup your **HubSpot** Oauth2 creds using [n8n docs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/trigger-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.hubspottrigger/)
3. Set the email content and subject
4. Click the Test Workflow button, enter your email and check the Slack channel
5. Activate the workflow and use the form trigger production URL to collect your leads in a smart way 

## How to adjust this template
You may want to raise or lower the threshold for your leads, as you see fit. 
You also need to update the content (the email and the subject), obviously üòÖ.

parameters.content:

3. Set the email content and subject
4. Click the Test Workflow button, enter your email and check the Slack channel
5. Activate the workflow and use the form trigger production URL to collect your leads in a smart way

parameters.formDescription: We'll get back to you soon

nodes.name: Email is not valid, do nothing

assignments.name: html
assignments.value:
=Hello,

Thank you for filling out our form. We are excited to be able to help you.

Feel free to schedle a 30-minute call with me here: www.calendly.com/schedule/mutasem

Cheers,

Mutasem

main.node: Check if the email is valid
Email is not valid, do nothing

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
